pr_title: Add void transform that always produces null

timeline.bodyText: Minor nit here to think about . . . we seem to be using both void and null.  Would it make more sense to just consistently use void as it seems to better indicate there there is no expected value?
timeline.author: danielcweeks

replies.bodyText: Null is the human-readable string for the value produced by the transform. Void is the name of the transform. I considered naming it something like always_null but void seemed shorter and less error prone (was that alwaysNull or always-null?)
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.message: Add void transform that always produces null.
